content.body: At least 3 programming languages have an Amount-like thing in the standard library: Swift, Java, and F#. Several others have it in popular packages. Seems worth highlighting.
I can add a slide for this

`Quantity` seems to be the most popular name for it, except in Swift which uses the name `Measurement`. No one I saw uses `Amount`. That doesn't mean it's a bad name, it just means there is less precedent for it
content.formatted_body: Quantity seems to be the most popular name for it, except in Swift which uses the name Measurement. No one I saw uses Amount. That doesn't mean it's a bad name, it just means there is less precedent for it

content.body: IIRC we  also floated "quantity" a while back but didn't pick it
We can do a TG5 study at Stage 2 like we did with Temporal to decide between PlainDate, LocalDate, and CivilDate
